hackathon-description-text: Co-sponsored by the Monmouth School of Science, the vision of the third annual WorkWave Hackathon is to get talented developers together with the shared goal of creating an application for those that are visually impaired, hard of hearing or disabled, that will assist them in completing everyday tasks easier (or allow them to have a little more fun!).

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director of Field Service Engineering, WorkWave

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=400 Cedar Avenue, West Long Branch, NJ 07764, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Most importantly, the degree to which the application helps those in need

hackathon-location-address: 400 Cedar Avenue, West Long Branch, NJ 07764, USA
hackathon-description-header: Build an app from scratch to address the needs of someone that is visually impaired, hard of hearing, or disabled - win $1,000!
hackathon-location-description: Pollak Theater in Howard Hall at Monmouth University
